intro: Malpighia urens var. typica, commonly known as the Mexican beautyberry, is a shrub native to Central America and the Caribbean. It is characterized by its clusters of small, bright red berries that are edible and often used in local cuisines. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are oval-shaped with a slightly waxy texture. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sun exposure. The flowers are small, white, and clustered in inflorescences, contributing to its ornamental value.
